com.lavanya.api.repository

Interface FriendRepository

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.springframework.data.repository.CrudRepository<Friend,java.lang.Integer>, org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Friend,java.lang.Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.PagingAndSortingRepository<Friend,java.lang.Integer>, org.springframework.data.repository.query.QueryByExampleExecutor<Friend>, org.springframework.data.repository.Repository<Friend,java.lang.Integer>

    @Repository
public interface FriendRepository
extends org.springframework.data.jpa.repository.JpaRepository<Friend,java.lang.Integer>
    Repository extending JPA repository for persistence of Friend object.

    • Method Detail

      • existsByUserWhoInviteAndByUserInvited

        @Query(value="select count(u)>0 from Friend u where ?1 = u.userWhoInvite and ?2 = u.userInvited")
java.lang.Boolean existsByUserWhoInviteAndByUserInvited(User userConnected,
                                                                                                                                                           User userProfileVisited)
        Query to verify if two users have a friend relation.
        Parameters:
        userConnected - for the user connected and recognised in DB as the user who initiated the friend request.
        userProfileVisited - for the user with we need to check a friend relation and recognised in DB as the user who accepted the friend request.
        Returns:
        boolean true or false.

      • existsByUserInvitedAndUserWhoInvite

        @Query(value="select count(u)>0 from Friend u where ?1 = u.userInvited and ?2 = u.userWhoInvite")
java.lang.Boolean existsByUserInvitedAndUserWhoInvite(User userConnected,
                                                                                                                                                         User userProfileVisited)
        Query to verify if two users have a friend relation.
        Parameters:
        userConnected - for the user connected and recognised in DB as the user who accepted the friend request.
        userProfileVisited - for the user with we need to check a friend relation and recognised in DB as the user who initiated the friend request.
        Returns:
        boolean true or false.

        Query to retrieve list of friends requests a user received.
        Parameters:
        userConnectedId - id of the user of interest for which the list of friends is retrieved.

      • findByUserInvitedIdAndUserWhoInviteId

        Friend findByUserInvitedIdAndUserWhoInviteId(int userInvitedId,
                                             int userWhoInviteId)
        Query to retrieve a specific Friend entity beween two users.
        Parameters:
        userInvitedId - id of one of the user of interest and recognised in DB as the user who accepted the friend request.
        userWhoInviteId - id of the second user of interest and recognised in DB as the user who initiated the friend request.
        Returns:
        a friend.

      • findByUserInvitedIdOrUserWhoInviteId

        @Query(value="select u from Friend u where isAccepted = 1 and ?1 = u.userInvited  or ?1 = u.userWhoInvite")
java.util.List<Friend> findByUserInvitedIdOrUserWhoInviteId(User userConnected)
        Query to retrieve list of friends where a specific user is associated.
        Parameters:
        userConnected - as the user of interest for which the list of friends is retrieved.
        Returns:
        list of friend.

      • countOfFriends

        @Query(value="select count(*) from Friend u where u.isAccepted = 1 and u.userWhoInvite = ?1 or u.userInvited = ?1")
java.lang.Integer countOfFriends(User user)
        Query to retrieve the total amount of friends of a particular user.
        Parameters:
        user - for which we need to determine the amount of friends.
        Returns:
        Integer for the resulting count.
